channel.title: Mac on Kelvin Nicholson
channel.description: Recent content in Mac on Kelvin Nicholson

item.title: Geocoding Photos (Mac)
item.description:
I’ve recently started using OSX (again), and am really enjoying it (again). One Windows-only tool that I found really useful isÂ Geosetter, which allows you to add geo coordinates into photos. There don’t appear to be any free geocoding tools that work to my satisfaction to do this, so the next best thing was geocode like you would using Linux. Here’s how.

We’re going to use the command line program ExifTool (by Phil Harvey) to extract coordinates from a gpx file and embed them in a directory of images.
